workflow.name: Automate event registration and reminder emails with Forms, Sheets & Gmail
workflow.description:
## How it works  
This workflow automates event registrations and attendee communication from initial signup to event day. It captures form submissions, prevents duplicate entries, and stores registrations in Google Sheets. Confirmed attendees receive immediate confirmation emails, while failures trigger admin alerts. A scheduled process then sends pre-event and event-day reminders, with all communication tracked to ensure emails are sent only once.

## Step-by-step  
- **Step 1: Capture and process registration**  
  - **Event Registration Form** ‚Äì Collects attendee details through a public registration form.  
  - **Edit Fields** ‚Äì Normalizes and prepares form data for processing.  
  - **Read Existing Registrations** ‚Äì Fetches existing attendee records from Google Sheets.  
  - **Check for Duplicate Email** ‚Äì Compares the submitted email against stored records.
  - **If Not Duplicate** ‚Äì Stops the workflow when a duplicate email is detected and continues only for new registrations.  
  - **Store Registration (Google Sheets)** ‚Äì Appends the new registration only when no duplicate is found.  

- **Step 2: Confirm registration and send notifications**  
  - **Add Status & Event Date** ‚Äì Assigns confirmed status and event date to the registration.  
  - **Check Registration Success** ‚Äì Verifies whether the registration is confirmed.  
  - **Send Welcome Email** ‚Äì Sends a confirmation email to the attendee.  
  - **Send Admin Alert** ‚Äì Sends an alert email to the admin if registration fails. 
  - **Code in JavaScript** ‚Äì Confirms email delivery and prepares tracking data.  
  - **Update Welcome Email Status** ‚Äì Updates the welcome email status in Google Sheets.  
 

- **Step 3: Scheduled trigger and reminder routing**  
  - **Schedule Trigger** ‚Äì Runs daily to initiate reminder processing.  
  - **Edit Fields** ‚Äì Marks the execution source as a scheduled run.  
  - **Switch** ‚Äì Ensures the workflow runs only for scheduled executions.  
  - **Get Confirmed Aptitude Candidates** ‚Äì Retrieves confirmed event registrations from Google Sheets.  
  - **Filter Reminder Candidates** ‚Äì Calculates remaining days until the event.  
  - **Switch Reminder Type** ‚Äì Routes attendees to 3-day or event-day reminder flows.  

- **Step 4: Send reminders and update event communication status**  
  - **Loop 3-Day** ‚Äì Iterates through attendees eligible for the 3-day reminder.  
  - **Send 3-Day Reminder** ‚Äì Sends a personalized pre-event reminder email.  
  - **Prepare 3-Day Update** ‚Äì Prepares reminder status data.  
  - **Wait** ‚Äì Adds delay to control email sending rate.  
  - **Update 3-Day Status** ‚Äì Updates the 3-day reminder status in Google Sheets.  
  - **Loop Event-Day** ‚Äì Iterates through attendees eligible for the event-day reminder.  
  - **Send Event-Day Reminder** ‚Äì Sends final event-day instructions and check-in details.  
  - **Prepare Event-Day Update** ‚Äì Prepares event-day reminder tracking data.  
  - **Wait** ‚Äì Adds delay between event-day emails.  
  - **Update Event-Day Status** ‚Äì Updates the event-day reminder status in Google Sheets.  

## Why use this?  
- Blocks duplicate registrations automatically at submission time.  
- Sends instant confirmation emails to attendees.  
- Alerts admins immediately when a registration fails.  
- Delivers perfectly timed reminders without manual follow-ups.  
- Keeps a complete communication log inside Google Sheets.

workflow.name: Event Registration And Reminder Automation (Pre-Event + Event Day)

parameters.content:
## Event Registration Automation with Email Workflow
This automation manages the complete event registration lifecycle‚Äîfrom form submission to event day reminders. It prevents duplicate registrations, sends personalized welcome emails, and delivers timely reminders based on attendee interests.

### How It Works
### Registration Flow:
- Captures registrations through a web form (First Name, Last Name, Email, Company, Interests)
- Checks for duplicate emails against existing registrations
- Stores new registrations in Google Sheets with "confirmed" status
- Sends personalized welcome emails immediately upon successful registration
- Updates spreadsheet to track email delivery status
- Sends admin alerts if registration fails

### Automated Reminder System:
- Runs daily at 9 AM via scheduled trigger
- Scans all confirmed registrations for upcoming events
- Sends 3-day advance reminder with personalized agenda based on interests
- Sends event-day reminder with check-in details and venue information
- Updates tracking flags (preEventEmailSent, eventDayEmailSent) to prevent duplicate emails
- Processes reminders in batches with small delays between sends

### Setup steps
1. Connect Google Sheets: Link your Google Sheets account and select the "Event Registrations" spreadsheet
2. Connect Gmail: Authenticate your Gmail account for sending welcome and reminder emails
3. Copy the form webhook URL: Find the webhook URL from the "Event Registration Form2" node
4. Customize the form: Modify form fields, dropdown options (interests), and form title/description as needed
5. Set event date: Update the event date in "Add Status & Event Date2" node (format: DD-MM-YYYY)
6. Customize email content: Edit email templates in nodes: "Send Welcome Email2", "Send 3-Day Reminder1", and "Send Event-Day Reminder1"
7. Configure admin email: Update admin email address in "Send Admin Alert2" node
8. Set reminder schedule: Adjust the daily trigger time in "Schedule Trigger1" if needed (default: 9 AM)
9. Turn the workflow ON
10. Test the registration: Submit a test registration through the form and verify all emails are received

## Step 1: Capture and Process Registration
When a user submits the event registration form, the workflow first verifies the submission using a Switch node if the form is submitted. It then checks whether the submitted email already exists in the system.If no duplicate is found, the registration data is stored in Google Sheets.If a duplicate email is detected, the workflow stops to prevent duplicate entries.

## Step 2: Confirm Registration and Send Notifications
After the registration data is stored, the system assigns a confirmed status and event date to the entry. It then checks whether the registration is successful and sends a welcome email to the attendee if confirmed. Once the email is sent, the workflow updates the email status for tracking purposes. If the registration fails, an alert email is automatically sent to the admin for review.

## Step 3: Scheduled Trigger and Reminder Routing
When the schedule trigger runs, the workflow first uses a Switch node to confirm the execution source is the scheduled run and not a form submission. Once validated, it fetches all confirmed event registrations from Google Sheets and calculates the days remaining until each event. Based on this calculation, attendees are classified into 3-day reminder or event-day reminder groups and routed to the appropriate reminder flow.

## Step 4: Send Reminders and Update Event Communication Status
Once reminder candidates are identified, the workflow processes them in batches to avoid overload. Attendees scheduled for a 3-day reminder receive a personalized email based on their interests, while event-day attendees receive final check-in and venue details. After each email is sent, the system updates the corresponding reminder status in Google Sheets, ensuring reminders are sent only once and tracking remains accurate.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
